title: Dynamic Earth Models
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: Our findings were used to guide NERC Theme Action Leader to proposed a Directed Research Project. This was a success and a Directed Research Project was taken forward by NERC leading to a Call, and 3 Consortia have been funded. Energy,Environment Policy & public services
findingsText: This project was a scoping study responding to a call requesting help to prepare a call in the Earth System Science theme related to the 'influence of mantle and core for a habitable Earth'. This grant focussed on integrated Dynamic Earth Models, where plate motion history driven mantle geodynamics, building on studies of mineralogy, seismology and rheology, with impact on such important aspects as volatile cycles, core dynamics, magnetic field and dynamic topography were investigated. This study involved meetings, preparations of white-papers, and a workshop. It merged with two other scoping studies which focussed on Dynamic Topography and Rheology respectively and ultimately produced a substantial and focussed document for the Earth System Science Theme Leader. The findings were used by the Theme Action Plan Leader to formulate a Directed Programme which was ultimately selected by NERC for support. Energy,Environment
